channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Fans at the Olympics are trading commemorative pins from different countries
item.description: While athletes are focused on the sports, some fans at the Olympics are busy trading souvenir pins from different countries.
item.content:encoded: While athletes are focused on the sports, some fans at the Olympics are busy trading souvenir pins from different countries.
item.dc:creator: Ayesha Rascoe

item.title: Women are leading the medal tally for Team USA at the Olympics
item.description: At the Paris Summer Olympics, gymnasts Simone Biles and Stephen Nedoroscik were going for individual medals in the vault and pommel horse.
item.content:encoded: At the Paris Summer Olympics, gymnasts Simone Biles and Stephen Nedoroscik were going for individual medals in the vault and pommel horse.
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: Protests over election results in Venezuela aren't losing steam
item.description: Venezuela's president, Nicolas Maduro, continues to insist he won last week's election, but proof is scarce. Meanwhile, Venezuelans continue to protest.
item.content:encoded: Venezuela's president, Nicolas Maduro, continues to insist he won last week's election, but proof is scarce. Meanwhile, Venezuelans continue to protest.
item.dc:creator: Carrie Kahn

item.title: Social media is flooded with disinformation about the presidential candidates
item.description: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe speaks with Liz Landers, a national correspondent at Scripps News, about false information that has been appearing on social media to influence the 2024 election.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe speaks with Liz Landers, a national correspondent at Scripps News, about false information that has been appearing on social media to influence the 2024 election.
item.dc:creator: Ayesha Rascoe

item.title: Politics chat: Trump and the presidential debate, Harris' running mate announcement
item.description: Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump is trying to renegotiate the terms of a debate he had earlier agreed to. Also, Vice President Kamala Harris will announce her running mate imminently.
item.content:encoded: Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump is trying to renegotiate the terms of a debate he had earlier agreed to. Also, Vice President Kamala Harris will announce her running mate imminently.
item.dc:creator: Mara Liasson

item.title: In Paris, the Olympics pushed out thousands living on the edge of the city
item.description: Paris displaced thousands of people living in encampments on the edge of Paris to make way for the games.
item.content:encoded: Paris displaced thousands of people living in encampments on the edge of Paris to make way for the games.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: The racial income gap has narrowed for Black Americans, new research shows
item.description: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe speaks with Harvard economics professor Raj Chetty about new research showing increased economic mobility among Black adults who grew up poor.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe speaks with Harvard economics professor Raj Chetty about new research showing increased economic mobility among Black adults who grew up poor.
item.dc:creator: Ayesha Rascoe

item.title: Magnesium is social media's new favorite magic aid for sleep. Here's what science says
item.description: Is there anything to the social media craze for using magnesium supplements to help you get to sleep?
item.content:encoded: Is there anything to the social media craze for using magnesium supplements to help you get to sleep?
item.dc:creator: Maria Godoy

item.title: A new bill could bring relief to those displaced after the wildfires in Maui
item.description: After the Maui wildfires worsened a massive housing shortage on the island, many community members advocated for government officials to take action against short term vacation rentals. Now, they are.
item.content:encoded: After the Maui wildfires worsened a massive housing shortage on the island, many community members advocated for government officials to take action against short term vacation rentals. Now, they are.
item.dc:creator: Catherine Cluett Pactol

item.title: The week in news and politics, from the newsmakers themselves
item.description: We have a round-up of candidates, in their own words, from the presidential race.
item.content:encoded: We have a round-up of candidates, in their own words, from the presidential race.
item.dc:creator: Ayesha Rascoe
